lead_paragraph: Beginning in 2021, students must receive a passing score on the exams known as Parcc, which has met resistance from parents, educators and activists.

headline.print_headline: New Jersey Board Ties Graduation to Tests Aligned With Common Core Standards
headline.main: New Jersey Ties Graduation to Tests Aligned With Common Core Standards

snippet: Beginning in 2021, students must receive a passing score on the exams known as Parcc, which has met resistance from parents, educators and activists....
abstract: New Jersey Board of Education votes to require that high school students must pass Partnership for Assessment of Readiness for College and Careers tests, which are aligned with controversial Common Core standards, in order to graduate, starting in 2021.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Partnership for Assessment of Readiness for College and Careers (Parcc)
